div.p: Letter press book, p. 197, Collection of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (SA Branch) Inc., State Library of South Australia, Adelaide.
Baron Sir F. von Mueller K.C.M.G.

Your favour of 18th inst. was received. We are sorry that Mr Helms has not been content to work pleasantly with our Council.
Richard Helms, appointed naturalist to the Elder Scientific Exploring Expedition. His case is referred by the Council to our Sub-Committee on Exploration. There seems to be no action open, in view of his defiances of the Council, and insubordination, but to recall him. With this possibility before us the question arises as to whether it may become desirable to forward someone else to Western Australia, to supersede him. In such case a qualified man will be required. Will you keep the matter before your mind, & see if you have anyone in view. Please do not treat this as otherwise than confidential at this stage.

As to the " Antarctic ". We have arranged for a representative Deputation to wait upon our Government on Monday next; & will report. Sir Thomas Elder has placed his name at the head of The Subscription List for the £100 -

He refers also (confidentially to our Council) to the £5000 offer which he made & was published in your papers in November of last year(?). That promises holds good still, on the understanding that adequate funds, to make the matter an assured success, are forthcoming. Can you inform me authentically what amount is required in all, to enable the Expedition to be sent out to do efficient work? £30.000 is the sum named here. Is that the required amount? Excuse, pray, my troubling you: but an authentic estimate is desirable
A reply by return mail, if convenient, would be a favour.
